Annotation.String: This resource contains information about a specific Job scheduled or being executed by a Redfish service's Job Service.
This resource shall be used to represent a job in a Redfish implementation.
Jobs can be create with an Insert operation.
A jobs can be modified with an Update operation.
Jobs can be removed with a Delete operation.
The status of the job.
The value of this property shall indicate the health status of the job.
The state of the job.
The value of this property shall indicate the state of the job.
The date-time stamp that the job was started or is scheduled to start.
The value of this property shall indicate the time the job was last started or will start as scheduled.
The date-time stamp that the job was last completed.
The value of this property shall indicate the time the job was completed.
The completion percentage of this job.
The value of this property shall indicate the completion progress of the job, reported in percent of completion.
The person or program that created this job entry.
The value of this property shall be the user name, software program name, or other identifier indicating the creator of this job.
The URI used to monitor the status of this Job.
This property shall contain a URI at which the JobService .
The Schedule Settings for this Job.
This object shall contain information detailing the scheduling for this job and the re-occurrence frequency for future instances of this job.
The HTTP and JSON payload details for this job.
This object shall contain information detailing the HTTP and JSON payload information for executing this job.
A link to a collection of Steps for this Job.
This property shall contain the link to a collection of type Job.
This is an array of messages associated with the job.
The value of this property shall be an array of messages associated with the job.
The available actions for this resource.
The Actions property shall contain the available actions for this resource.
A new job.
This value shall represent that this job is newly created but the operation has not yet started.
Job is starting.
This value shall represent that the operation is starting.
Job is running normally.
This value shall represent that the operation is executing.
Job has been suspended.
This value shall represent that the operation has been suspended but is expected to restart and is therefore not complete.
Job has been interrupted.
This value shall represent that the operation has been interrupted but is expected to restart and is therefore not complete.
Job is pending and has not started.
This value shall represent that the operation is pending some condition and has not yet begun to execute.
Job is in the process of stopping.
This value shall represent that the operation is stopping but is not yet complete.
Job has completed.
This value shall represent that the operation is complete and completed successfully or with warnings.
Job was cancelled..
This value shall represent that the operation is complete because the job was cancelled by an operator.
Job has stopped due to an exception condition.
This value shall represent that the operation is complete and completed with errors.
Job is running as a service.
This value shall represent that the operation is now running as a service and expected to continue operation until stopped or killed.
Job is waiting for user intervention.
This value shall represent that the operation is waiting for a user to intervene and must be manually continued, stopped or cancelled.
Job is to resume operation.
This value shall represent that the operation has been resumed from a paused condition and should return to a Running state.
The HTTP and JSON payload details for this job resource.
This type shall contain the HTTP and JSON payload details used to execute the job described by this resource.
The URI of the target for this job.
This property shall contain a URI referencing a location to be used as the target for a POST or PATCH.
The HTTP operation to perform to execute this job.
This property shall contain the HTTP operation to execute for this job.
This represents the HTTP headers used in the operation of this job.
The value of this property shall be an array of HTTP headers used in the execution of this job.
This property contains the user name for use with this job.
The value of this property shall be the user name for this job.
This property is used with a POST write the password for use in the job. This property is null on a GET.
The value of this property shall be the password used for this job. The value shall be null for GET requests.
This property contains the JSON payload to use in the execution of this Job. This property is null on a GET.
The value of this property shall be JSON formatted payload used for this job. The value shall be null for GET requests.
The URI of the Response Monitor to use for this Job.
This property shall contain a URI to a Task Monitor as defined in the Redfish Specification.
The available actions for this resource.
This type shall contain the available actions for this resource.
The available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This type shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.
